alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 08 at 9:38PM CST until March 08 at 10:15PM CST by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHERN HASKELL COUNTY... At 930 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated only a few light sprinkles in the warned area. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Haskell, Stamford, Paint Creek, Irby and Sagerton. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek. The Haskell Sheriff Office reported numerous roadways with low water crossings flooded and closed this evening in Haskell, including on a spillway along a creek that runs through the city. The flooding started around 818 PM. Radar estimated rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 1/2 inches fell from Sagerton to Haskell to Irby this evening. The heaviest was near Sagerton. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
